p: As Bcc breakpoints were not available for all antibiotics tested against the Bcc, where necessary breakpoints were those advocated by the British Society for Antimicrobial Chemotherapy (BSAC) for the respective method for Pseudomonas spp. [ 29] and for this reason P. aeruginosa NCTC10662 was included as a reference strain (Bcc members were previously classified in the genus Pseudomonas). Also B. cepacia LMG 16656/J2315 from panel strains of the Bcc [ 25] was included in the study, allowing better comparison of our results with other studies.
